name: NSAccessibilityTable
desc: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a table view.

items.name: func accessibilityColumnHeaderUIElements() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the column header accessibility elements for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityColumns() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the column accessibility elements for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityLabel() -> String?
items.desc: Returns a short description of the table.

items.name: func accessibilityRowHeaderUIElements() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the row header accessibility elements for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityRows() -> [NSAccessibilityRow]?
items.desc: Returns the row accessibility elements for the table.

items.name: func accessibilitySelectedCells() -> [Any]?
items.desc: The currently selected cells for the table.

items.name: func accessibilitySelectedColumns() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the currently selected columns for the table.

items.name: func accessibilitySelectedRows() -> [NSAccessibilityRow]?
items.desc: Returns the currently selected rows for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityVisibleCells() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the visible cells for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityVisibleColumns() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the visible columns for the table.

items.name: func accessibilityVisibleRows() -> [NSAccessibilityRow]?
items.desc: Returns the visible rows for the table.

items.name: func setAccessibilitySelectedRows([NSAccessibilityRow])
items.desc: Sets the tableâ€™s currently selected rows.
